SOMEONE approaches... Through the mists of morning ... In leather coat and jack He's early 30s, with the vaguely whimsical confidence of that refuses to fade ... This is RANDALL RAINES, whom they call MEMPHIS - though k quite sure why ... But they do know he's the auto-boost i California ... Memphis approaches the Mustang with a gathering awe ... L crash survivor coming upon an oasis ... He walks around i Admiring it ... Adoring it ... But then a FIREBIRD pulls up alongside him. Its driver - ATLEY JACKSON, early 30s, handsome, jocular leans out for

He removes a SLIM JIM from a deep pocket coat... He slims the door panel ... Pops the button ... o door ... Watch him work. Quick as shit. A SCREWDRIVER appears anot pocket ... He pops the BUTTERFLY to the IGNITION A RATCHET appears... He strips the mechanism... Now a GIZ socket-like device - is pressed into the ignition ... A twist of the wrist ... And the 320-bhp 289 like a jackhammer. The whole thing took 20 seconds. He takes a cassette TAPE from another pocket ... Slaps it deck. Bruce Springsteen's "Ramrod" wails from the coaxial And Memphis floors it... And off they tear... The look on his face suggests a supreme satisfaction ... re-awakening of long-dormant pleasure centers ... A speed fixed and fumy ... He slots in behind Atley Jackson's Firebird ... And slott behind Memphis, in a Z-28, is DONNY ASTRICKY, mid-30s ... On they go ... The fore and aft car providing escort... Except that, from seemingly out of nowhere --

QUICK SHOTS of Memphis racing the Shelby through the earl harbor town streets ... Sirens peel ... Memphis turns up ... Pins the gas ... The chase is on ... Memphis maneuvers the Mustang with a dazzling aplomb... M gutterballing the car, skating the shoulder, the cops in pursuit ... And now he's picked up another CRUISER... He passes Atley heading in the opposite direction... Atley has picked-up cruisers himself ... Memphis on a straightaway now, speeds up, feels the boost ahead, a ROADBLOCK has formed... How'd they get that depl fast? And behind him, the unmarks blaze ... Guns his bitch... Straight at the roadblock .. Three CRUI a PORTABLE WOODEN BARRICADE... Memphis pins her ... ZOOOO to the roadblock ... And, at the last moment, as the COPS dive out of the way, bangs the gear shift into neutral -- yanks the parking br And the Mustang spins on the straight -- Screeching spin Memphis takes the HARD LEFT ... And he's managed to outrun them... Finding himself above Grand... Looking down ... He can see the secondary pursuit down below ... Atley bei chased... IN THE DISTANCE - Atley is LAUNCHED FROM THE SH the Firebird rolling down a drainage culvert ... Landing with a sickening thud on its back. Memphis is hor

dialogues.text: Leg's all banged-up. He made a stupid play ... He'll limp around the yard up at Folsom. But Astricky will be there to take care of him. With their priors, they're looking at a serious bounce --

dialogues.text: You don't have anything on me. A misdee auto-theft. I got no record. I'll be out in three days, and back at  it. Or you let them go, and I give you my word. I'm gone. And without the ringleader ... Your tee-times have just grown exponentially...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out of here, then. Now. And Memphis makes to get into the Shelby... DETECTIVE CASTLEBECK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave the car, Randall ... Memphis nods ... Takes one last look at the Shelby... Sor leave it behind ... And he runs off into the mists of Low Grand ... Castlebeck walks back toward the crime-scene tumult ... DETECTIVE CASTLEBECK

dialogues.text: Some 400 miles North of Los Angeles, Independence is a on horse town, and the horse has died... Single stop light, single-engine firehouse, single everything. Norman Rockwe would find this burg a snooze.. - We settle on a small, GARAGE ... The peeling sign reads:

dialogues.text: owned and operated by Memphis Raines ... In blue coverall Memphis has a Plymouth Duster up on the lift ... With him - TOM, 19... Lightnin' Hopkins' "Automobile Blues" plays MEMPHIS

dialogues.text: Right. You want to test the voltage drop ... Use the voltmeter ... Remove the primary lead from the ignitioncoil and crank her ... See what you got ... You understand -- ? Tom starts to say "not really". Instead, he nods. Memphis root beer from an old-style machine. He goes out ... fron where an old Denver Pyle-coot - BUDGY - sits on a bench, an unfiltered Lucky ... Memphis sits beside him, pets the 200-year-old DOG that lounges nearby... BUDGY

dialogues.text: 1980 Mercury Cougar. 255 cubic inch V8 ... Based on the Ford Thunderbird bodyshell; they modified the chassis, but didn't improve its performance... Budgy points at another car ... And we get the sense they this game every day... MEMPHIS (cont'd)

dialogues.text: The 1970 Plymouth Road Runner. Proof positive of a single all-powerful Deity. The first bargain-priced muscle car ever. They even tuned the horn to resemble the "beep beep" sound of the cartoon Road Runner ... And Budgy looks impressed... As always ... BUDGY

dialogues.text: Damn, you're good Memphis nods ... Sips his root beer ... BUDGY (cont'd)

dialogues.text: That I did, Budgy. That I did -- And, from inside the garage, there's the most horrific GR metal on metal, as Tom has started the Plymouth - TOM (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

But I should tell you: I'm working for him now - The Carpenter - so if you see him, you won't mention me coming to get you... Like I said: I just thought ... I owed you ... dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing -- ? MEMPHIS

dialogues.text: Tell you what I'm not doing: I'm not gonna let you get into my Kool Aid... And Memphis is on him... They go rolling about in grunts groans - eddies of sawdust swirling - the NOISE of the ta drowning out the sounds of combat ... Calitri is on top, grabbing an AWL from the floor, bringi lethal point down to Memphis' face... Memphis holds Calit wrist, straining, the point inches from his eye ANGLE - FLOOR SOCKET - right above Memphis' head. With a gasp, Memphis misdirects the awl so it STABS THE FLOOR SO small CLAP OF VOLTAGE shaking through their bodies, as th akimbo ... Both men are momentarily paralyzed as the electricity sor out inside of them... Calitri is up; and he's found the g He crawls over to Memphis, climbing on him, sitting down the younger man's chest ... But then Memphis grabs him by and tosses Calitri off him ... Memphis POUNDS Calitri's h the floor ... Once, twice. Three times. Calitri is out ... Memphis gets feet, nose bloody. He catches his breath. Only the door o And Atley is there ... ATLEY JACKSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My version of "take this job and shove it..." ATLEY JACKSON

dialogues.text: Are you crazy? You throw down with The Carpenter? You got a grudge against your life? But before Memphis can respond, there are APPROACHING ENG SOUNDS from up the alleyway -- as A PANEL VAN arrives. Me Atley look at the wall-clock. 8:05. A glance to the uncon Calitri ... ATLEY JACKSON (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now you done it. And with you gone - who'll save Kip the next time ... ? MEMPHIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is all about there not being a next time, Atley -- And the two men hold the look... And the van doors slam, and Butz, Calitri's grave-diggers, get out ... Atley goes unconscious Calitri ... And he picks him up, straining un dead weight ... Dragging the don over to THE OPEN CASKET - One final burst of strength and Atley d Calitri into the casket... Slamming the swell top lid of coffin. He turns to look at the shocked Memphis -- As Dig Butz are there - ATLEY JACKSON

dialogues.text: He's napping. He said to take it away... Atley gestures to the coffin. And they pick it up, move i van... DIGGER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That'll do ya. Tell Mr. C. we was by. MEMPHIS

dialogues.text: Absolutely. And they are gone ... And Atley turns to Memphis ATLEY JACKSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ding Dong The Witch Is Dead, right? MEMPHIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Point-five ... And he holds out his hand ... And they shake ... ATLEY JACKSON

dialogues.text: Get outta here, Memphis -- And Memphis does ... Nods to Atley... MEMPHIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you... Atley nods ... Memphis walks out to the loading dock... A watches him go ... ATLEY JACKSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hoo-boy.

dialogues.text: Memphis walks to the battered Eleanor ... As Pearl Jam's "Rearviewmirror' crunches and a CAR comes motoring up to ANOTHER 167 SHELBY. ANOTHER ELEANOR, a "For Sale" sign pa the back window. It's being driven by Kip... MEMPHIS

dialogues.text: It's over. The dumb shit is over ... The unmarked pulls up behind him... The cop comes over .. of course, Detective Castlebeck. DETECTIVE CASTLEBECK

And he goes back over to Memphis ... DETECTIVE CASTLEBECK (cont'd)

dialogues.text: Your brother's a clever man and a talented thief, Kipling. But as role models go, you should observe the man, not the thief ... KIP

dialogues.text: I want you gone, Randall. Settle your affairs. Make it right with those you love. Hell, take 'em with you. But I want you out of here. Out of here for good this time ... MEMPHIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Otto, The Sphinx, Tumbler, Freb and Mirror Man are sippin and eating donuts ... They are exhausted... Memphis and K up in Eleanor... He hands Otto the briefcase. Otto opens that cash... MEMPHIS

dialogues.text: She left... He nods ... The boys are huddled together... MIRROR MAN

dialogues.text: Poor Toby, man... A few beats of silence as they remember; then shockingly: THE SPHINX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If his premature demise has, in some way, enlightened the rest of you as to the grim finish below the glossy veneer of criminal life, and inspired you to change your ways, then his death carries with it an inherent nobility. And a supreme glory. We should all be so fortunate. You can say 'Poor Toby." I say: "Poor us.." They all stare at him, stunned... FREB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You spoke The Sphinx shrugs... TUMBLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say something else, man But The Sphinx lapses back into his silence ... Nibbles a ... Sips coffee ... Memphis smiles ... He takes a stack o from the briefcase... To Kip: MEMPHIS

dialogues.text: Dinosaurs. All of us. The Ice Age is now... MEMPHIS

dialogues.text: Sway, underneath a Daytona... We only see her from the wa ... Hands on her waist ... Pulls her gently out. Memphis. brings her to her feet ... SWAY

dialogues.text: And begin to dump shovelfuls of earth upon it; its unseen thumping and pounding and yelling -- And soon the casket covered in dirt. Gone. And we PRE-LAP The Turtles' pop gem "Eleanor" ("You got a about you/I just can't live without you/I really want you/ Eleanor near me...")  CUT TO:
